Subject: How to Poison Your Muse: The Toxic Twins of Talent and Art
Description: We'll discuss how common ideas about talent and art sabotage our creativity. What are these traps, and how can we avoid them? A discussion for artists, authors, musicians, and anyone else who wants to create good stuff.  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Michael Cieslak - Track: Life  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Character Problems - What's an Author to Do?
Description: A main character needs to start out annoying, boring, or unappealing. (they have to grow from somewhere!) Your readers say 'ugh' and set your book aside. What's an author to do? How do we avoid this? Examples?  Speakers include:Mary Lynne Gibbs, Paul Kemner, Emmy Jackson, Cindy Spencer Pape, Jeff Pryor - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Reading/Signing: Paul Kemner and Jon David
Description: Join our attending authors in the Writers Block (317 & 318) for readings and signings!  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Jon David - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Tools for Outlines: M.I.C.E., The Three Act Structure
Description: Is your story about Milieu, an Idea, a Character, or an Event? Figure out what sort of story you want to tell, and see which elements are most important, how you might want to structure the story, and how to tell if you've reached the end.   Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Michael K. Elliot - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes

Subject: Mechanics of Magic in Fantasy & SF
Description: Does a magical system for a story need rules? Costs, unintended consequences, social factors? What about reliability issues? How can we avoid worn-out tropes. How should magic in an RPG and story differ? Is some of the tech in SF 'magic' and should the same considerations apply?  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Ericka S. Kahler, Eric S. Raymond, Andrew Zimmerman Jones - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes
